title: Yet another handwriting sample... "Software MacKiev"
content:
Hey Guys,

I know there are only a couple of hand fonts out there to choose from ;-), but can’t seem to ID this sample. Does anyone recognize it? Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [logo\_mc\_gor.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20060524083410/http:/typophile.com/files/logo_mc_gor.jpg) | 4.82 KB |
author: SF Highlander

comments.content:
Are you sure it’s not hand lettered? The ‘a’s seem to be different widths (it’s hard to tell), and there aren’t any other repeating characters.

- Lex

Hey Lex,

Thanks for your post. With this type of sample it can always be hand lettered, and its certainly not easy to tell with such a small example, but I \*think\* the a’s and the e’s look like they are the same… I could definitley be wrong.

Do you (or anyone) have some good substitutes that might work instead? Thanks!

These are the people who do the Mac version of KidPix, a program my daughter has. I looked at the CD package and it does appear to be a font—the a’s and e’s are identical. Don’t know what it is, though.
